result.execSummary:
The defendant William H. Craig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: each other and to 17CI1

miscConds.notes:
No contact with Victim J.L.T.

No contact with any other females under 18 years of age except with PO approval.

No contact with C.K. except for contact by letter/in writing only for purposes of child custody and placement issues in Marathon County case 14FA759 or as otherwise allowed for by Order by the COURT in that case. May have contact with C.K. as approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Coply with any treatment and comply with Supervised Release plan in 17CI1.

Any treatment/assessment/counseling as deemed appropriate.

Registration as Sex Offender for lifetime of Defendant.

No credit for time already served in this case.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather.
Case Called: 8:25 a.m.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence in person. Defendant appears via Zoom from WSPS, pro se; Agent K.S. appears in person.
Date and time set for motion to reconsider vacating no-contact order.

ADA Lawrence indicates the State is in agreement with the letter the COURT sent the Defendant.
Defendant indicates his agent denied contact with the victim and makes arguments.
Agent makes statement.
COURT GRANTS motion and modifies JOC to include language "May have contact with C.K., as approved by agent".

Adjourned: 8:35 a.m.
Sentencing Hearing 5/24/19
Motion hearing on February 9, 2022 at 08:20 am. (Mailed copy of Notice to Victim/bls)
Motion to Reconsider vacating No-Contact Order w/proposed Order and cover ltr. - stj
re: no contact order
Re: Motion and Order to Vacate No Contact Order (pro se)

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:50pm
State appears by Special Prosecutor Kevin Greene (17CI1) and DA Theresa Wetzsteon (14CF1036); Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Evan Weitz (in 17CI1) and with Attorney Andrew Martinez (in 17CI1).

COURT notes stipulation to admission of petition has been reviewed as filed by and sentencing is needed in 14CF1036.
State requests moving forward in 14CF1036 with stipulated sentencing recommendation; Parties state one issue on condition of probation of no contact with K.K., and Atty Martinez makes argument.
Attorney Martinez makes statement.

14CF1036>>
COURT ORDERS: 20 years probation on each count, concurrent to each other and concurrent to 17CI1.
CONDITIONS>> Comply with any treatment and comply with Supervised Release. plan in 17CI; No contact with victim J.L.T.; No contact with any other females under 18 years of age except with PO approval; No contact with K.K. except for contact by letter/in writing only for purposes of child custody and placement issues in Marathon County case 14FA759 or as otherwise allowed for by Order by the COURT in that case; Any treatment/assessment/counseling as deemed appropriate; CC; Registration as Sex Offender for lifetime of defendant; DNA surcharge.
>> Defendant is NOT eligible for either SAP and CIP.
>> No credit for time already served in this case.

17CI1>> Stipulation to Admission agreement filed 
Atty Greene states stipulation to admission and conditions of supervision.
COURT questions Mr. Craig regarding the stipulation stated by counsel on record.
PLEA: NO CONTEST
COURT finds admission freely and voluntarily made.

COURT Orders defendant to be placed at Sand Ridge and adopts all conditions as listed in written agreement.
having found to be sexually violent supervised release, Defendant committed to DHS for control care and treatment until such time as he is found not to be a sexually violent. Mr. Craig to be placed in facility for institutional care; provide to satisfaction a biological specimen for DNA analysis; Sheriff to deliver defendant to DHS facility at Sand Ridge.
COURT E-signs orders

Defendant requests to be returned to Sand Ridge today - COURT does not object however matter is entirely up to MC Sheriff's Dept/Jail.
